body_html:
@girving Thx for your comment.
I find the Supervisor class, and it's init is as below:

def init(self, graph=None, ready_op=USE_DEFAULT, is_chief=True,
init_op=USE_DEFAULT, init_feed_dict=None,
local_init_op=USE_DEFAULT, logdir=None,
summary_op=USE_DEFAULT, saver=USE_DEFAULT,
global_step=USE_DEFAULT, save_summaries_secs=120,
save_model_secs=600, recovery_wait_secs=30, stop_grace_secs=120,
checkpoint_basename="model.ckpt", session_manager=None,
summary_writer=USE_DEFAULT, init_fn=None):

The arguments save_model_secs and save_summaries_secs are the time interval to save checkpoint file and event file separately.
So I guess at least the sv is still running, but I'm not sure whether something wrong or waiting for data in the session.run

body:
@girving Thx for your comment.
I find the Supervisor class, and it's **init** is as below:

>  def **init**(self, graph=None, ready_op=USE_DEFAULT, is_chief=True,
>                init_op=USE_DEFAULT, init_feed_dict=None,
>                local_init_op=USE_DEFAULT, logdir=None,
>                summary_op=USE_DEFAULT, saver=USE_DEFAULT,
>                global_step=USE_DEFAULT, save_summaries_secs=120,
>                save_model_secs=600, recovery_wait_secs=30, stop_grace_secs=120,
>                checkpoint_basename="model.ckpt", session_manager=None,
>                summary_writer=USE_DEFAULT, init_fn=None):

The arguments `save_model_secs` and `save_summaries_secs` are the time interval to save checkpoint file and event file separately. 
So I guess at least the sv is still running, but I'm not sure whether something wrong or waiting for data in the `session.run`
